creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: boat with three sails and small dinghy at center, reflecting on water; silhouettes of smaller boats at UL; white mist-like wash in sky; darker grey, purple, and pale orange colors
inscription: left margin: {jizuri, Seto naikai shuu, Taisho 15 nen saku hansen - yuu} | bottom margin: Sailing Boats-Evening | Hiroshi Yoshida | left: 瀬戸内海集　大正拾五年作　帆船 夕 {Seto naikai shū, Taishō jūgonen saku, Hansen, yū} | bottom, in pencil: Sailing Boats-Evening |  Hiroshi Yoshida
medium: Woodblock print; ink and colors on paper
portfolio: From The Inland Sea Series (Seto naikai shū 瀬戸内海集)
title: Sailing Boats: Evening
